metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29534 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.9.3. io_uring takes a non-refcounted reference to the files_struct of the process that submitted a request, causing execve() to incorrectly optimize unshare_fd(), aka CID-0f2122045b94. Jann Horn discovered that the io_uring subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly perform reference counting in some situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information or possibly escalate privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-29534` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-37-generic - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-5.13.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-generic - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-generic-64k - 5.11.0-16.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-37-lowlatency - 5.11.0-16.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1019-aws - 5.11.0-1006.6
